item.title: Node.js: Testing a Node.js API with Mocha, Async, and Should
item.description: Node.js: Testing a Node.js API with Mocha, Async, and Should Application Overview The API is broken down into bundles, each bundle is stored in a separate folder and contains a model and a controller. The application has the following directory structure. -/bundles/ -/bundles/foo/model.js -/bundles/foo/controller.js -/bundles/bar/model.js -/bundles/bar/controller.js The controllers extend from a base module called controller.js which implements the create/review/update/delete code. Testing the API The rest of this article will concentrate on the DELETE api call.
